text.p: The Fisher-Snedecor probability distribution is a probability distribution that arises in the testing of whether two populations have the same variance. Mathematically this distributions describes the probability distribution of the variable that result of the quotient of two independent chi-square distributions with m and n degrees of freedom, each divided by its degrees of freedom.
The parameters that define this distribution are the degrees of freedom of the numerator and denominator, that are the sample size minus one of the samples drawn from both populations.
